newsitem.title: INDIA: India bank shares jump on economic revival hopes.
newsitem.headline: India bank shares jump on economic revival hopes.

text.p: Bank stocks jumped on Thursday at Indian bourses buoyed by hopes of economic revival, brokers said.
"Financial firms will be the first ones to gain from an economic turnaround," said Ketan Jhaveri, chief dealer at Kotak Securities, the Indian associate of Goldman Sachs.
A recent move the by the central bank to give more freedom to banks was also seen as boosting efficiency and profits.
The easier norms brought interest rates down and analysts see better profit margins as the business picks up.
At the National Stock Exchange, Bank of India rose 6.7 rupees to 73.50, Bank of Baroda 6.80 to 84.30, HDFC Bank 3.95 to 62.05 and Oriental Bank 2.45 to 74.65.
Foreign funds were buying into other bank stocks as foreign portfolio holdings in SBI, the country's biggest commercial bank, had reached the ceiling of 20 percent.
The Bombay exchange was closed for a local holiday.
